# Random Actions No Repeat [(by TerrierDarts)](https://www.twitch.tv/TerrierDarts)
## Description
This extension will all you to create little groups of actions that when triggered, they will randomly play one of the actions. The next time its triggered it will play a different one, eventually it will go through all the actions before repeating any of the previous actions.
> If you ever get the same action twice in a row this is just due to the end of the last loop and the start of a new one. {.is-info}

## Set Up
One you've imported the code you will notice you have 6 new actions, the first thing you will want to do it rename you queue, you can do this by editing the `Set Argument` in the `exampleQueue-Main` Action. Also set how many actions are going to be in this Queue. ![ranr-subactions.png](/extensions/random-actions-no-repeat/images/ranr-subactions.png)
> I would highly recommend using camelCase when naming your Queue {.is-warning}

Once you've set on a name you can rename the action, and then you will need to create the randomActions you will be triggering with the queueName plus a number up to as many as you have. In my example my queue was called `exampleQueue` and I have `5` Actions. So my naming scheme was like this. ![ranr-actions.png](/extensions/random-actions-no-repeat/images/ranr-actions.png)

You will now just need to choose how this queue is triggered, but if you was going to set this up as a chat command you would tie it to the Main Sub-Action and all that to do the set of the work.

> To create duplicate queues, just create a duplicate of your Main action and refollow the steps above for your new queue. {.is-info}

> When set up correctly you can now easily have multiple **Random Action No Repeat Queues** {.is-success}
